structural_unit_name.en: Chair of General and Microbial Biochemistry

description.en:
Topics of the course include
-protein structure
-basic  principles of  of enzymatic catalysis
-structure and function of carbohydrates and lipids
-nucleic acid structure
-basic metabolic routes of carbohydrates, lipids and amino acids
description.et:
Kursuse põhiteemadeks on
-valkude struktuur
-ensümaatilise katalüüsi põhiprintsiibid
-süsivesikute ja rasvade struktuur ja funktsioon
-nukleiinhapete struktuur
-rasvade, süsivesikute ja aminohapete peamised metaboolsed rajad

objectives.en: The course aims to provide a general understanding of basic principles of biochemistry, the structure of main biochemical molecules and function of metabolic pathways.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on anda ülevaade peamistest biokeemia põhiprintsiipidest, biokeemiliste molekulide struktuurist ja metaboolsete radade toimimisest.

learning_outcomes.en: After the course, the students are expected:
- to be familiar with main classes of biological macromolecules and their constitutive monomeric compounds
learning_outcomes.et: - tunda peamisi bioloogilisi makromolekule ja nende monomeere.

learning_outcomes.en: - to understand the role of catalysis in biochemistry .
- to understand the basic metabolic reactions network, major regulatory points of catabolism and anabolism .
learning_outcomes.et: - teada põhilisi metaboolseid radu ja olla tuttav anabolismi ja katabolismi peamiste regulatsioonikohtadega.

learning_outcomes.en: - to relate biochemical reactions and organic chemistry and to understand how abrogation of normal metabolism can lead to human disease
learning_outcomes.et: - võimet siduda biokeemilise reaktsioone üldiste keemiliste printsiipidega ja mõista, kuidas normaalse metabolismi häired võivad põhjustada inimeste haigusi.

description.et: Final written exam consists of more than 10 questions. In order to pass, students must answer more than 50% of questions accurately.
Final written exam, consists of more than 10 questions. In order to pass, students must answer more than 50% of questions accurately.

grade_preconditions.et: Registreerumine ainele, osavõtt loengutest, registreerumine hindamisele.

grade_evaluation.et: Final written exam, consists of more than 10 questions. In order to pass, students must answer more than 50% of questions accurately.

name.en: Chair of General and Microbial Biochemistry

structural_unit.address:
Riia 23b/2
51010 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.et: Overview of the course, introduction to biochemistry as chemistry of living organisms. Thermodynamic angle to life, basic principles of biochemistry.
Chemical bond types prevalent in biochemistry. Properties of water, acid and bases, buffering systems.
General structure and properties of amino acids, properties of peptide bond.
Main types of protein structure, four levels of protein folding, thermodynamic problems associated with it.
Basic concepts of thermodynamics, enzymes as catalysts.
Enzyme structure, enzyme classes, types of catalysis mechanisms.
Enzyme mechanisms and kinetics.
Enzyme regulation and kinetics.
Structure and classification of carbohydrates.
Structure and classification of lipids.
Structure of nucleic acids DNA and RNA.
Basic concepts in metabolism, how energy is extracted and stored, concept of activated carriers.
Overview of glycolysis and its regulation.
How end-product of glycolysis is shuttled to TCA cycle, function and regulation of afforementioned cycle.
Oxidative phosphorylation, mitochondrial electron transport chain, ATP synthase and thermogenesis.
Exam 1
Exam 2
Independent learning process between lectures, where students cover topics from textbooks and e-sources.
